720131f-a.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Lewis Street
720131f-a.text:
Grand Street, north side, west from (No. 350), but not inoluding Lewis
Street, showing the R. Hoe & Co. plant,between Columbia and Sheriff Streets.
TRe 3-story house (No. 550) snown on the extreme right, is a frame structure
with a brick front. The Hoe plant was demolished in 1930, and replaced by a
modern apartment dwelling, as a slum clearance pOject.
April 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
720131f-a.folder: Grand Street & Lewis Street, Manhattan, NY

720907f-a.title: Manhattan: Lewis Street - Grand Street
720907f-a.text:
Lewis Street, north from, but not including Grand Street. The Williams
burg Bridge is shown transversing the roof tops at Delancey Street.
Pebruary 12, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
720907f-a.folder: Lewis Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720130f-a.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Lewis Street
720130f-a.text:
546-556 Grand Street, west of, adjoining, and at the N.W. corner
of Lewis Street. No. 550 is a 3-story frame house with a brick front.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Mueeum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 301.
720130f-a.folder: Grand Street & Lewis Street, Manhattan, NY

720132f-a.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Lewis Street
720132f-a.text:
(1)
558-566 Grand Street, north side, east from and including Lewis
Street. These are all frame houses with brick fronts. The view also
shows 2-4 Lewis Street, at, adjoining, and north of the N.E. corner
of Grand Street. No. 2 is a 3-story frame house.
~ :  G 542S  1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 568.
(2)
The same.
April 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
